page.title: 04SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: TAYSIDE REGIONAL COUNCIL HAVE PASSED PLANS TO ALLOW WORK TO GO AHEAD TO WIDEN THE NOTORIOUS CHURCH CORNER. THIS AT PRESENT IS A 90 DEGREE RIGHT HAND BEND AND HAS ALWAYS CAUSED PROBLEMS FOR ALL TRAFFIC.THE EXPENDITURE OF Â£40,000 OFFFERS LITTLE EXTRA RELIEF TO THE TRAVELLER AND SEEMS TO BE MONEY MISSPENT. VILLAGERS ARE AT PRESENT CAMPAIGNING TO HAVE THE MONEY BETTER SPENT ON A BYPASS ROAD WHICH WAS PROMISED IN 1914, ALMOST STARTED IN 1934 AND THWARTED TWICE BY PUBLIC OBJECTIONS IN 1972 AND 1974. AT THIS POINT IN TIME A REPORT HAS BEEN READ AND APPROVED BY THE REGIONAL COUNCIL AND PLANS ARE IN HAND FOR A NEW BYPASS.WE AWAIT THE OUTCOME OF ANY PUBLIC INQUIRY AND HOPE THAT BY { _ WE HAVE BEEN BY_PASSED.-
